extractions.description: This study conducts the first fine-grained empirical examination of ML testing practices in real-world applications. It highlights the testing strategies used by ML engineers, specific ML properties being tested, and types of testing utilized throughout the ML workflow.

title.value: Studying the Practices of Testing Machine Learning Software in the Wild
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at both the beginning of the paper and in the provided document citation.
title.quote: Studying the Practices of Testing Machine Learning Software in the Wild

type.justification: The research involves conducting a study on real-world practices, which aligns with empirical investigation.
type.quote: To fill this gap, we perform the first fine-grained empirical study on ML testing practices in the wild, to identify the ML properties being tested, the followed testing strategies, and their implementation throughout the ML workflow.

research_field.justification: The paper focuses on testing practices within the Machine Learning domain.
research_field.quote: We are witnessing an increasing adoption of machine learning (ML), especially deep learning (DL) algorithms in many software systems

sub_research_field.justification: The paper specifically examines software testing practices within the context of Machine Learning.
sub_research_field.quote: Few recent research advances in the quality assurance of ML systems have adapted different concepts from traditional software testing, such as mutation testing

name.justification: The model is mentioned as being part of a recommendation system in the study.
name.quote: lightFM [74] is a recommendation system based in Python, developed by Lyst, a Fashion e-Commerce site based in London.

type.justification: Directly stated in the paper as a recommendation system.
type.quote: lightFM [74] is a recommendation system based in Python, developed by Lyst, a Fashion e-Commerce site based in London.

name.justification: Mentioned as part of the Numenta Platform for Intelligent Computing, which is based on HTM algorithms.
name.quote: Numenta Platform for Intelligent Computing is an implementation of Hierarchical Temporal Memory (HTM), a theory of intelligence based strictly on the neuroscience of the neocortex.

type.justification: HTM is stated to implement intelligent computing theories.
type.quote: Numenta Platform for Intelligent Computing is an implementation of Hierarchical Temporal Memory (HTM), a theory of intelligence based strictly on the neuroscience of the neocortex.

name.justification: The model is named as an object detection model used in the paper.
name.quote: An object detection model on mobile devices. It uses the Generalized Focal Loss [76] for regression and classification loss.

type.justification: Clearly defined as an object detection model
type.quote: An object detection model on mobile devices.

name.justification: Mentioned as a speech recognition engine within the study.
name.quote: An embedded (offline, on-device) open source speech recognition engine which can run in real time on devices ranging from a Raspberry Pi 4 to high power GPU servers.

type.justification: Specifically stated as a speech recognition engine.
type.quote: An embedded (offline, on-device) open source speech recognition engine

name.justification: Referenced as a toolkit used in DeepSpeech for language modeling.
name.quote: DeepSpeech an NLP system make use of the KenLM Language Model Toolkit [60] in performing many of its tasks

name.justification: Cited as a framework widely utilized for numerical operations and handling arrays.
name.quote: Moreover, Python provides a cross-platform library called Psutil 5 (process and system utilities) that allows for retrieving the information on running processes and system utilization (memory, disks, CPU, network). name.justification: Identified as one of the primary testing frameworks utilized in the study.
name.quote: frameworks like pytest may work better for higher-level testing such as using test fixtures.
